text: Why do materials sometimes appear bright magenta (pink) in the Unity Editor?

options.text: It’s common to import a material that was originally made for a shader that isn’t present in the current project. To fix, specify a shader that is in the project.
Materials appear pink if they are missing a base map or color. To fix, add a color.
A material created for one GameObject can’t be applied to another without being configured properly. To fix, adjust the material for each new GameObject.
A pink material indicates an error in the shader script. To fix, correct the error or select a different shader.
When a material is built for a shader of a different render pipeline than the current project, it is bright magenta (pink) to alert you.

feedbackCorrect: When a material is built for a shader of a different render pipeline than the current project, it is bright magenta (pink) to alert you.
feedbackIncorrect: Shaders and materials work together to define all the characteristics of a mesh surface during the rendering process. A material is an asset that works with a shader to define how meshes will be rendered.
